comments.body: Errors are usually returned as the second argument, not the first.

this is true. however, errors are the main subject of this interface: the
error that's returned here is not because WaitFor failed ... it's because
the error you were hoping to see within the duration actually showed up.
also it seemed (to me) more natural for callers to write: err, ok :=
WaitFor(someDuration)
